sentences.english: It is not consumption at all , it seems.
sentences.chinese: 他的病本來就不像是癆病。

sentences.english: My step-grandmother was thin and black in short height with serious tuberculosis.
sentences.chinese: 我的繼外祖母身體矮而黑瘦，有嚴重的癆病。

sentences.english: After a couple of years, we heard that she had developed consumption, and had also become addicted to opium.
sentences.chinese: 過了兩年，聽說她已生了癆病，吸上鴉片煙了。

sentences.english: Apoplexy is no longer to be feared, but phthisis is there.
sentences.chinese: 不用再怕腦溢血了，癆病卻還存在。

definition: yellow face, emaciated body (idiom); malnourished and sickly in appearance
top-heavy/fig. unbalance in organization or political structure
disorder of internal organs caused by overexertion
shaking in fear/one's heart palpitating with fear
impotence/also written 陽痿|阳痿[yang2 wei3]
chest and hypochondrium/upper part of the body
(TCM) plum-pit qi, a feeling of a lump in the throat (globus pharyngis) or of stagnant phlegm
